question: Which boxing defense technique in which a boxer attempts to hold or "tie up" the opponent's hands when the distance between both fighters has closed and straight punches cannot be employed so that he is unable to throw hooks or uppercuts?
explanation: Clinching is a form of trapping or a rough form of grappling and occurs when the distance between both fighters has closed and straight punches cannot be employed. In this situation, the boxer attempts to hold or "tie up" the opponent's hands so he is unable to throw hooks or uppercuts.
